name: market for sodium nitrate, technical grade | sodium nitrate, technical grade | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/20010/documentation

This is a market activity. Each market represents the consumption mix of a product in a given geography, connecting suppliers with consumers of the same product in the same geographical area. Markets group the producers and also the imports of the product (if relevant) within the same geographical area. They also account for transport to the consumer and for the losses during that process, when relevant.;This activity represents the market for 1 kg of sodium nitrate, technical grade. Technical grade sodium nitrate has a ourity of over 99%. This purity is required is sodium nitrate is used as thermo-solar salt.;Transport distances are taken from the ecoinvent Global default transport model, available on the ecoinvent website www.ecoinvent.org.

Activity starts with the product ready for transport.

Activity ends with the delivery of the product to the consumer.
category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2012:Manufacture of fertilizers and nitrogen compounds

exchanges.description: Sodium nitrate (NaNO3), crystal form used as industrial chemical for industries like glass, explosives, ceramic frits, enamel glazes, metal treatment and odor control for water treatment and as a solar salt component for Concentrated Solar Power (CSP) applications.

exchanges.description: Transport distance based on US BTS Commodity Flow Surveys 1993, 1997, 2002, 2007, US Dep. Of Transportation, Bureau of Transportation Statistics. Of the total road transport, 6% is assumed to be by delivery van for goods with a large share of retail sale, and 3% for goods that are mainly sold via wholesale.

exchanges.description: The total marine transport volume differentiated into major commodity groups based on data from FearnResearch (2001): Fearnley's Annual Review 2000. Oslo: Fearnley/AS, p. 1-78. The category “Other cargo” accounts for 38% of total maritime transport volume and has been distributed on commodity groups based on the proportions in the marine import and export of the US in 2001-2010.
